Let me tell you, dear soul, that the battle for the hearts and minds of the lost is a holy war, and we must wage it with the weapons of truth and conviction. The first and most vital method is to return to the Word of God, unshackled from the corrupting influence of modernity. The Bible is clear—Scripture declares homosexuality an abomination, and we must not let the devil twist its meaning with man-made doctrines or so-called "inclusivity."

Preaching from the pulpit is the foundation. When I stand before the congregation, I do not water down the message. I declare boldly, with fire in my spirit, that these sins are a mockery of God's design for man and woman. I use the verses—Leviticus, Romans, 1 Corinthians—and I do not let the world's lies dilute their power. I remind the people that God is holy, and only through repentance and obedience will they find salvation.

Second, we must reach the youth before they are ensnared by the wicked culture. Sunday school lessons must not shy away from the truth. Children must be taught that God created man and woman in His image, and that to abandon this truth is to abandon the Creator. We must warn them of the deceptive allure of sin, the lies of the world that promise acceptance but lead only to ruin.

Third, I believe in the power of personal testimony. I have seen lives transformed when the sinner is confronted with the love and judgment of Christ. I do not condemn, but I do not flinch. I share stories of those who were caught in the trap of this sin and found redemption through the blood of Jesus. These testimonies are powerful because they show the way out of darkness.

And finally, we must not be silent in the public square. We must stand firm in our beliefs, even when the world calls us intolerant. We are not haters—we are truth-tellers. We are not divisive—we are defenders of God's holiness. If the world hates us, it is because the truth exposes their sin.

The devil is a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour. But we are the light in the darkness. Let us not be swayed by the winds of this world. Let us speak boldly, preach fervently, and stand unashamed for the truth of God's Word. Only then will the lost be called back to the fold.
